intro: Hieracium lipskyanum, commonly known as the Lysianthus hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, thriving in temperate climates. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Hieracium lipskyanum is known for its hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in dry conditions.
